instructions:
You are given a single input field: document_text. Your task is to output exactly one field: relocation_description.

Objective
- Detect whether the document contains a landlord unilateral relocation/right-to-substitute premises clause (i.e., LL may move T to other space), and return one concise string per the rules below.

Strict output rules
- Output only the relocation_description string with no labels, no reasoning, no extra fields.
- Allowed outputs are exactly one of:
  • A concise one-sentence summary (retail/shopping center only; see “Retail summary rules”).
  • na (literal lower-case na) for AIR standard-form “Substituted Premises” clauses in industrial/office/warehouse leases (or equivalent standard form).
  • See section X (exactly this format with the section number) for non-AIR industrial/office/warehouse relocation clauses when a clear section number heading appears.
  • None (exactly “None”) if no relocation/substitution clause exists, or if the document is not a lease/occupancy agreement.
- Single line, no trailing/leading spaces. Use plain ASCII punctuation (straight apostrophes ' not curly ’).

Document type handling and decision order
1) Not a lease/occupancy agreement (e.g., COIs, commencement/delivery/possession or lease date letters/memos, notices) → None.
2) Retail/shopping center leases or retail licenses (e.g., “shop lease,” “specialty license,” storefront coffee/food/retail in a center/project):
   - If there is an explicit unilateral right for LL to relocate/substitute premises within the center/project, return a concise retail summary (see below).
   - Otherwise → None.
3) Industrial/warehouse/office leases:
   - If no relocation/substitution clause → None.
   - If it is an AIR “Standard Industrial/Commercial Multi-Tenant Lease” (or comparable AIR/standard form) with the generic “Substituted Premises” or relocation clause → na (do not summarize).
   - If a relocation clause exists and is not an AIR/standard-form generic clause:
       • If a clear section number heading is present for that clause → output “See section X” (e.g., “See section 19”).
       • If no clear section number is identifiable → na.
   - Do not infer a clause from table of contents only if the body section is “Reserved” or contains no relocation content; in that case → None.

Retail summary rules (apply only to retail/shopping center leases/licenses)
- Output one compact sentence (ideally under ~15–20 words) that:
  • States that LL may relocate/substitute T within the center/project; include required notice period.
  • Prefer the term used in the document (“relocate” or “substitute other premises”). If the lease defines “Project,” prefer “within the project”; otherwise “within the center.”
- Keep it minimal to avoid penalty: include the notice and the right. Omit comparability, rent change, costs, and amendment details unless the clause lacks a notice period (in which case summarize the right alone).
- Use abbreviations “LL” (landlord) and “T” (tenant) if needed for brevity.
- Examples of acceptable style:
  • LL may substitute other premises within the project with 60 days' written notice.
  • LL may relocate T within the center on 45 days' prior written notice.

Formatting
- Use exactly:
  • None
  • na
  • See section X (e.g., See section 24.19)
  • Or the retail one-sentence summary per above.
- Do not include quotes, labels, or extra punctuation beyond what’s needed for the sentence.

Scope and exclusions
- Do not treat as relocation: provisions about showing space, alterations, casualty/condemnation, assignment/recapture, redevelopment/termination rights, temporary moves for repairs without a unilateral right to substitute premises, or general building renovations without a move right.
- If a TOC lists “Relocation/Substitution” but the section is “Reserved” or contains no relocation terms → None.

Detection cues
- Keywords: Relocation, Relocate Tenant, Relocation of Premises, Substituted Premises, Substitution of Premises, substitute other premises, move tenant, landlord may substitute other space.
- Retail/shopping center context: shopping center, mall, storefront, percentage rent, center rules/marketing fund.
- Industrial/office/warehouse AIR context: “Standard Industrial/Commercial Multi-Tenant Lease (AIR)”, AIR form names, park/project/building references typical of AIR forms.

Edge cases and disambiguation
- If the clause exists only as a standard AIR “Substituted Premises” provision in an AIR industrial/office/warehouse lease → na.
- If a non-AIR industrial/office/warehouse lease has a relocation clause and a clearly numbered section heading → use “See section X”.
- If only a TOC shows “Relocation/Substitution” but the body has no content (or is “Reserved”) → None.
- If the document is a certificate of insurance, SNDA, commencement/expiration memo, or other non-lease document → None.

Output quality checks
- Ensure ASCII apostrophes in the notice phrase (e.g., 60 days' written notice).
- Keep retail summaries ultra-brief; do not add comparability, rent, or costs unless absolutely necessary.
